content:
Re: Version identifier in URL

Larry Masinter (masinter@parc.xerox.com)
Wed, 29 May 1996 16:32:14 PDT

  • Messages sorted by: [ date ][ thread ][ subject ][ author ]
  • Next message: Christopher Seiwald: "Re: Version identifier in URL"
  • Previous message: Larry Masinter: "Re: Version identifier in URL"
  • Maybe in reply to: Jim Whitehead: "Version identifier in URL"
  • Next in thread: Christopher Seiwald: "Re: Version identifier in URL" 
> Peeking into the syntax of a URL is an abstraction violation.
> Telling folks "watch out! Don't spell your URLs this way, cuz
> that syntax is reserved for version info" is a no-no.

Well, there's already precedent for form URLs, for example, e.g.,

  http://host.dom/form-handler?x=a+y=b+z=c

even though the client treats any URL it receieves as 'opaque', they
can still be constructed. I see some value in just continuing this
tradition for versions.

In fact, how about making a "version" just a special kind of
query?

Larry
